Ugh, don't even get me started. I just found out that my ex-girlfriend cheated on me with my best friend. I can't believe they would do that to me.

I'm really sorry to hear that. Discovering betrayal from someone you trusted can be incredibly painful. It's understandable that you're feeling angry right now. If you don't mind me asking, how did you find out about this?
It was actually my other friend who saw them together and told me. I can't believe they were sneaking around behind my back. I trusted both of them, and they completely betrayed me.
That's a tough situation to be in. Betrayal can stir up a lot of anger and hurt. Have you had a chance to talk to either of them about what happened?
No, I haven't. I'm still trying to process everything and figure out how to confront them. I never expected something like this to happen, especially from people I considered close to me.

It's completely understandable that you're feeling angry and hurt right now. It can take time to gather your thoughts and decide how you want to address the situation. Is there anything specific you think you might say or do when you're ready to talk to them?

Honestly, I'm not sure. I want to confront them and let them know how much they hurt me, but I also don't want to let their actions consume me. I need to find a way to move forward and heal from this.

It's important to take care of yourself and prioritize your well-being in situations like these. While it can be helpful to express your feelings to them, it's also crucial to remember that your emotions matter. Is there anything that brings you comfort or helps you cope during difficult times?

I've been trying to focus on my hobbies, like reading and writing. They've always been a source of comfort for me and help take my mind off things. I also find solace in spending time with my friends who have been supportive throughout this.

That sounds like a great way to channel your emotions and find some relief. Hobbies and spending time with loved ones can be a helpful distraction and offer a sense of support. It's also important to remember that healing takes time, and it's okay to give yourself space to process everything. If you ever need someone to talk to, I'm here for you.
Thank you, I appreciate that. It's been a tough journey, but having someone to talk to means a lot. I didn't expect to find support like this in such a difficult time.
